title: Switching parties 'the new norm' as current electorate is named the most volatile in modern times
text:
Half of the electorate has switched party since 2010, leading to the most volatile electoral landscape in modern times, according to a new study.

The 2015 and 2017 general elections saw the highest number of people changing their vote since 1964, when the British Election Study started.

Some 49 per cent of people did not vote for the same party across the last three general elections.

With a snap election highly likely to be called before the end of 2019, these latest figures set the scene for what could be one of the least predictable general elections ever.
